original: oṃ namaḥ śivāya sa śivāya śivadāya namo namaḥ /
analyzed: om namaḥ śivāya sa śivāya śiva dāya namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Om, salutations to Shiva, the auspicious one, the bestower of auspiciousness, salutations, salutations.

analyzed: om namaḥ paramātmane
translated: Om, salutations to the Supreme Self.

analyzed: om namaḥ vighna hartre
translated: Om, salutations to the remover of obstacles.

analyzed: atha haṃsasāram likhyate
translated: Now, the essence of the swan is being written.

analyzed: śrutam deva mayā pūrvam amalam haṃsa yāmalam
translated: O Lord, I have heard before the pure swan-colored (mantra),

analyzed: punar hi śrotum icchāmi sārāt sārataram param
translated: I wish to hear again the supreme essence that is more essential than the essence.

original: yatpurā kathitaṃ deva sūcitaṃ na prakāśitam /
analyzed: yat purā kathitam deva sūcitam na prakāśitam
translated: What was told before, O Lord, indicated but not revealed,

original: vadame vastu sadbhāvaṃ prasādaṃ kuru śūla bhṛt // //
analyzed: vadame vastu sadbhāvam prasādam kuru śūla bhṛt
translated: Please tell the true nature of that reality, be gracious, O trident-holder.

analyzed: sādhu sādhu mahā prājñe sarva satva artha bodhini
translated: Excellent, excellent, O greatly wise one, who enlightens the purpose of all beings,

analyzed: tad artham saṃpravakṣyāmi tava snehāt maheśvari
translated: Out of affection for you, O Mahesvari, I shall explain it for that purpose.

analyzed: durlabham sarva devānām yoginīnām tathā eva ca
translated: It is difficult to obtain for all gods and yoginis alike,

original: yo sau śānto hyajo devaḥ śaktyādhāro hyavigrahaḥ // //
analyzed: yaḥ sau śāntaḥ hi ajaḥ devaḥ śakti ādhāraḥ hi avigrahaḥ
translated: That unborn god who is tranquil, the support of Shakti, who is formless,

analyzed: jīva bhūtaḥ sadā tiṣṭet vāma dakṣiṇa madhya gaḥ
translated: Always abides as the living being, residing in the left, right, and middle.

original: p / ca caiṣa paramohaṃsaḥ sa vai devaḥ sanātanaḥ // //
analyzed: ca ca eṣa paramaḥ haṃsaḥ sa vai devaḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: And he is the supreme swan, that is the eternal god.

original: sa brahmā sa ca vai rudra īśvaro viṣṇureva ca /
analyzed: sa brahmā sa ca vai rudraḥ īśvaraḥ viṣṇuḥ eva ca
translated: He is Brahma, he is Rudra, he is Isvara, and he is Vishnu.

original: sadāśivaḥ paraṃdhāma tārakaṃ brahma eva ca // //
analyzed: sadāśivaḥ paraṃdhāma tārakam brahma eva ca
translated: Sadasiva is the supreme abode, and also the liberating Brahman.

original: vārāṇasyāṃ tu deveśi svakaṃ mārgaṃ prakāśitam /
analyzed: vārāṇasyām tu deveśi svakam mārgam prakāśitam
translated: O Goddess of the gods, in Varanasi, my own path has been revealed.

analyzed: ajñānam ca eva tat kṣetram jñāninām avrataḥ sthitam
translated: That field is indeed ignorance, and the vow of the wise is established there.

original: lakṣaṇaṃ tasya vakṣyāmi yena jñāsyanti sādhakāḥ /
analyzed: lakṣaṇam tasya vakṣyāmi yena jñāsyanti sādhakāḥ
translated: I will tell its characteristics by which the practitioners will know it.

original: gurvavasthā gamaḥ so hi dṛśyate na tu lakṣyate // //🔽sa paraḥ sarvato hyātmā cañcalatve vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: guru avasthā gamaḥ saḥ hi dṛśyate na tu lakṣyate  / sa paras sarvatas hi ātmā cañcala tve vyavasthitaḥ
translated: He is indeed the state of the guru, seen but not perceived.🔽He is the supreme Self, established in motion everywhere.

original: sa bāhyābhyantarastho hi spandate sarvadehinām // //🔽nityoditaśca niṣṭaśca anādirnidhaneśvaraḥ /
analyzed: sa bāhya ābhyantara sthaḥ hi spandate sarva dehinām  nityoditaḥ ca niṣṭaḥ ca anādiḥ nidhana īśvaraḥ
translated: He abides both externally and internally, vibrating in all embodied beings.🔽He is ever-arisen and ever-set, the beginningless and ending Lord.

analyzed: avyaktaḥ vyakta rūpaḥ ca agrāhyaḥ ca cala acalaḥ
translated: He is unmanifest and manifest, ungraspable, both moving and unmoving.

analyzed: bhāva grāhyaḥ sa cit mātra caitanya a su sthitaḥ sthitaḥ
translated: He is graspable as existence, mere consciousness, and abides in the unmoving state of consciousness.

original: tejorūpī hi bhagavānhṛdvyomnevasthitaḥ paraḥ // //🔽p / bāhyavyomni sthito dhūmro dhūmrāgre prakṛtirvapuḥ /
analyzed: tejaḥ rūpī hi bhagavān hṛd vyomnā iva sthitaḥ paraḥ  bāhya vyomni sthitaḥ dhūmraḥ dhūmra agre prakṛtiḥ vapuḥ
translated: The illustrious Supreme Lord, in the form of light, abides in the heart-space.🔽Abiding in the external space, he is smoky, with a smoky tip, his form is primordial nature.

original: śuddha sphaṭikasaṅkāśaṃ bhinnaṃ vyomni tu vyomavat // //
analyzed: śuddha sphaṭika saṅkāśam bhinnam vyomni tu vyoma vat
translated: Pure like crystal, he is distinct in the sky, like the sky itself.

analyzed: mukteḥ latā tad ākāram cittra āvalita tādṛśam
translated: The creeper of liberation has that form, variegated and coiled like that.

analyzed: bhramareṇa pratīkāśam
translated: Resembling a bee, with the letter ha and without a head.

analyzed: kula nātham param śāntam kula santati dṛśyate
translated: The Lord of Kula, supremely peaceful, is seen in the continuity of Kula.

original: siddhoti nūnaṃ tat tasmiñciva puṣpāṇi paśyati // //🔽ekoneka vibhedena koṭibhedena dṛśyate /
analyzed: nūnam tat puṣpāṇi paśyati  eka uneka vibhedena koṭi bhedena dṛśyate
translated: One who sees the flowers there is certainly accomplished.🔽He is seen with one form and many divisions, with millions of distinctions.

original: nānākāra vibhāgena dṛśyate parameśvaraḥ // //🔽havito piṅgalo dīpto niśi veśmani dṛśyate /
analyzed: nānā ākāra vibhāgena dṛśyate parameśvaraḥ  piṅgalaḥ dīptaḥ niśi veśmani dṛśyate
translated: The Supreme Lord is seen with various forms and divisions.🔽The tawny, radiant one, resembling fire, is seen in the house at night.

analyzed: sat vyoma jyotiḥ ūpaḥ asau nadate sa muhur muhur
translated: He, in the form of the light of the true sky, sounds again and again.

original: sa bāhyābhyantaraṃ lakṣyaṃ yo dadāti dine dine /
analyzed: sa bāhya ābhyantaram lakṣyam yaḥ dadāti dine dine
translated: He who gives the external and internal target day by day,

original: aghaṃśamaya te devi na kvacidyoni sambhavaḥ // //
analyzed: aghaṃśamaya te devi na kvacid yoni sambhavaḥ  /
translated: O Goddess, your sins are destroyed, you will not be born from a womb anywhere.

analyzed: janmāntara sahasrāṇi śivabhakti parāyaṇaḥ
translated: For thousands of other births, devoted to devotion to Shiva,

analyzed: tasya ca apaścimaṃjanma haṃsaḥ dṛśyaḥ varānane  /
translated: And in his last birth, O beautiful-faced one, the swan is seen.

analyzed: bhidyate hṛdaya granthi chidyante sarva saṃśayaḥ
translated: The knot of the heart is broken, all doubts are cut off,

original: kṣīyante cāsya karmāṇi tasmin dṛṣṭe parāpare // //
analyzed: kṣīyante ca asya karmāṇi tasmin dṛṣṭe parāpare
translated: And his actions are destroyed when the Supreme is seen.
The spiritual teacher who bestows the knowledge of the swan is difficult to find.

original: pṛthivyāṃ nāsti tad dravyaṃ yad datvā cāriṇī / vet // //
analyzed: pṛthivyām na asti tat dravyam yat da tvā cāriṇī vet
translated: There is no substance on earth by giving which the swan would know.

analyzed: atha atas saṃpravakṣyāmi kāla jñānam caṇa ambike
translated: Now, I shall explain the knowledge of time, O Ambika.

analyzed: kāla cihna parijñānam na adhogatiṣu yoginām
translated: The recognition of the signs of time is not for those who go downwards.

analyzed: bhujaṅga kuṭila ākāram agratas sarva tantuṣu
translated: The serpent is in the form of a curve in front, in all the threads.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvāpi ciraṃ devi punarjanma na vidyate // //
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā api ciram devi punarjanma na vidyate  /
translated: Even by seeing it, O Goddess, there is no rebirth.

analyzed: liṅga ākāre ghanena bandhanam bhavet
translated: In the form of the Linga, there is liberation from the Rishis, bondage by the dense one.

original: rakto yadā tanurvidyātpīte cārthasya sambhavaḥ // //🔽p / vyālairviśeṣagamanaṃ bindunādaprasādanam /
analyzed: raktaḥ yadā tanuḥ vidyāt pīte ca arthasya sambhavaḥ  / vyālaiḥ viśeṣa gamanam bindu nāda prasādanam
translated: When the body is red, one should know, and in the yellow one, there is the possibility of wealth.🔽When the serpent moves, there is special movement, the pleasing of the Bindu and Nada.

original: subhikṣaṃ ca pracāre ca durbhikṣaṃ cañcu bandhane // //
analyzed: subhikṣam ca pracāre ca durbhikṣam cañcu bandhane
translated: In the movement, there is good harvest, and in the beak bondage, there is famine.

analyzed: madhya chede tribhiḥ māsaiḥ mriyate na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: If it is cut in the middle, one dies in three months, there is no doubt.

original: tridivairdivase yukte mriyate ca tato dhruvam // //
analyzed: tri divaiḥ divase yukte mriyate ca tatas dhruvam
translated: If it is united with the three days, one dies from that, certainly.

original: pūrvāhṇe pūrvasaṃsthaṃ tu yathā dṛṣṭvā varānane /
analyzed: pūrvāhṇe pūrva saṃstham tu yathā dṛṣṭvā varānane
translated: O beautiful-faced one, having seen it in the east in the forenoon, as seen.

original: añjaliṃ vāripūrṇāyāṃ bhāvayeta vicakṣaṇaḥ // //🔽sāmastho dakṣiṇaṃ gatvā ṣaṇmāsānmṛtyumādiśet /
analyzed: añjalim vāri pūrṇāyām bhāvayeta vicakṣaṇaḥ  sāma sthaḥ dakṣiṇam gatvā ṣaṣ māsāt mṛtyum ādiśet
translated: The wise one should contemplate with folded hands filled with water.🔽Having gone to the south in the Sama state, one should predict death in six months.

analyzed: somasūya vibhāgena ahorātram nirīkṣayet  /
translated: One should observe the day and night by the division of the Soma sacrifice.

original: dvau māsau somasūryābhyāṃ māsaṃ somasya dakṣiṇe /🔽pūrve dakṣiṇamāvasyāṃ praviśedravimaṇḍale // //
analyzed: dvau māsau soma sūryābhyām māsam somasya dakṣiṇe  pūrve dakṣiṇa māvasyām praviśet ravi maṇḍale
translated: For two months, from the Sun and Moon, for one month, to the south of the Moon,🔽in the east, on the full moon day, one should enter the orb of the Sun.

analyzed: somāvasyām pañca aham sūrya ga uttare
translated: On the new moon day of the Moon, for ten days, for five days, the Sun is in the north.

original: ekaḥ kālasya paryāyaṃ kathitaṃ tava sundari // //
analyzed: ekaḥ kālasya paryāyam kathitam tava sundari
translated: One is the cycle of time, O beautiful lady, it has been told to you.

original: p / kālasya vañcanaṃ deva kathaṃ jānāti tattvataḥ /
analyzed: kālasya vañcanam deva katham jānāti tattvataḥ
translated: O God, how does one truly know the deception of time?

analyzed: etat hi saṃśayam brūhi atra kautūhalam mama
translated: Please tell me this doubt, I have a curiosity in this matter.

original: śṛṇu devi paraṃ guhyaṃ rahasyaṃ bhuvi durlabham /
analyzed: śṛṇu devi param guhyam rahasyam bhuvi durlabham
translated: Listen, O Goddess, to the supreme secret, the mystery, difficult to find on earth.

original: yanna kasya cidākhyātaṃ tat te vakṣyāmi suvrate // //🔽candramaṇḍalamadhye tu ṭhakāraṃ cintayet priye /
analyzed: yat na kasya cit ākhyātam tat te vakṣyāmi suvrate  candra maṇḍala madhye tu ṭhakāram cintayet priye
translated: What has not been told to anyone, that I will tell you, O you of good vows.🔽In the middle of the lunar orb, one should contemplate the letter Tha, O beloved.

original: ṭha madhyame gatohaṃsaścintanīyaḥ prayatnataḥ // //🔽brahmarandhrātsravantī ca paramāmṛtarūpiṇī /
analyzed: madhyame gataḥ haṃsaḥ cintanīyaḥ prayatnataḥ  brahmarandhrāt sravantī ca parama amṛta rūpiṇī
translated: In the middle, one should carefully contemplate the swan that has gone.🔽Flowing from the Brahmarandhra, in the form of supreme nectar,

original: avyayā sarvagā sūkṣmā parā cāsya parākalā // //
analyzed: avyayā sarva gā sūkṣmā parā ca asya parā akalā
translated: imperishable, all-pervading, subtle, and the supreme power of the Supreme Self.

original: haṃsodara gatā sā tu sravantī cintayet priye /
analyzed: sā tu sravantī cintayet priye
translated: O beloved, one should contemplate that flowing within the belly of the swan.

original: kālo na kalayeccātra na jarāvyādhireva ca // //
analyzed: kālaḥ na kalayet ca atra na jarā vyādhiḥ eva ca
translated: Time does not affect here, nor does old age or disease.

original: p / kālasya vañcanaṃ devi goptavyaṃ vīravandite /
analyzed: kālasya vañcanam devi goptavyam vīra vandite
translated: O Goddess, the deception of time should be kept secret, O Goddess worshipped by the heroes.

analyzed: gupta usānnidhyam icchanti mātaraḥ sādhaka īśvari
translated: The Mothers desire proximity when it is kept secret, O Queen of Sādhakās.

original: tasmāt sarvaprayatnena na deyaṃ yasya kasyacit /
analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena na deyam yasya kasyacid
translated: Therefore, by all means, it should not be given to anyone and everyone.

original: dātavyaṃ bhakti yuktānāṃ gurubhaktiratātmanām // //🔽guruśśiva gatojñeyaḥ śivogurumukhodgataḥ /
analyzed: dātavyam bhakti yuktānām guru bhakti rata ātmanām  guruḥ śiva gataḥ jñeyaḥ śivaḥ guru mukha udgataḥ
translated: It should be given to those endowed with devotion, whose minds are absorbed in devotion to the Guru.🔽The Guru should be known as having attained Śiva, and Śiva as having arisen from the mouth of the Guru.

original: yo guruḥ sa śivaḥ sākṣāt pūjanīyaḥ prayatnataḥ // //
analyzed: yaḥ guruḥ sa śivaḥ sākṣāt pūjanīyaḥ prayatnataḥ
translated: That Guru is indeed Śiva Himself, and should be worshipped with effort.

analyzed: śuciḥ dakṣaḥ vinītaḥ ca śaktiḥ ca api asya tat plutā
translated: He should be pure, skillful, humble, and his Śakti should be superior to him.

original: tasya jñānaṃ ca mokṣaṃ ca siddhyate paramārthataḥ // //
analyzed: tasya jñānam ca mokṣam ca siddhyate paramārthataḥ
translated: His knowledge and liberation are accomplished in the highest sense.

original: tasmin sthāne yadā līnaṃ cittaṃ vigatavṛttikam /
analyzed: tasmin sthāne yadā līnam cittam vigata vṛttikam
translated: When the mind, devoid of fluctuations, is absorbed in that place,

analyzed: valī palita nirmuktaḥ ṣaṣ māsena bhaviṣyati
translated: in six months he will be free from wrinkles and grey hair.

original: na kālaṃ kalayeccātra na ca sāvyādhireva ca /
analyzed: na kālam kalayet ca atra na ca sa avyādhiḥ eva ca
translated: He should not be concerned with time, nor should he be afflicted with disease.

original: haṃsasāraṃ paraṃ brahma paraṃ vyoma paraḥ śivaḥ // //
analyzed: haṃsa sāram param brahma param vyoma paraḥ śivaḥ
translated: The Supreme Brahman, the Supreme Sky, the Supreme Śiva is the essence of the Swan.

analyzed: tvad śreyaḥ ūrtham idam khyātam haṃsasāra samuccayam
translated: For your welfare, this collection of the essence of the Swan is being proclaimed.

analyzed: anāstikānām na ādeyam śaṭhānām krura cetasām
translated: It should not be given to the unbelievers, the deceitful, or those of wicked minds.

analyzed: dāmbhikānām abhaktānām tantra ācāra rata ātmanām
translated: For the deceitful, the non-devotees, and those whose minds are engaged in the practices of Tantra,

analyzed: yatas te paśavaḥ kīṭāḥ mahā mārga bahiṣkṛtāḥ
translated: Since they are animals, insects, and excluded from the great path,

analyzed: śaṅkā vikalpa nirdagdhāḥ mahā moha āndhya pīḍitāḥ
translated: Burnt by doubt and uncertainty, afflicted by the blindness of great delusion,

analyzed: anāśvastāḥ a santuṣṭāḥ paśu śāstreṣu bhāvitāḥ
translated: Unsatisfied, discontented, and cultivated in the scriptures of animals,

analyzed: na te labhante paramam mahā ūrmi nikara ākulam
translated: They do not attain the supreme, which is full of great waves and multitudes,

analyzed: ogha sarvasvam atulam guru vaktre samāgatam
translated: The incomparable essence of the current, which has come together in the teacher's mouth.

analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena dātavyam vīra vandite
translated: Therefore, O you who are praised by the heroes, it should be given with all effort,

analyzed: guru bhaktāya śāntāya nitya abhyāsa ratāya ca
translated: To one who is devoted to the teacher, peaceful, and always engaged in practice,

analyzed: vīra ācāra niṣaṇṇāya dravya advaita parāya ca
translated: To one who is established in the conduct of the heroes, and is devoted to the non-duality of substances,

analyzed: samayā sevine nityam kula kāla udite śive
translated: To one who always serves the samaya, auspicious in the time of Kula,

analyzed: a dāmbhikāya guptāya gupta ācāra ratāya ca
translated: To one who is not deceitful, hidden, and engaged in secret conduct,

analyzed: yatas pīṭhebhyaḥ pīṭha vigrahaḥ
translated: Since they are established in the form of the syllables of the Vidyā, the embodiment of the sacred seats,

analyzed: nityam bhrānti vihīnānām parokṣa ākārita aṃśritāḥ
translated: Always free from delusion, resorting to the aspect of being hidden,

analyzed: rakṣanti tāḥ kṛpā āviṣṭāḥ samayācāra pālakāḥ
translated: Protected, filled with compassion, and guardians of the conduct of the samaya,

analyzed: sarva bhāvaiḥ prayatnena prāṇa madhye ca mātaraḥ
translated: With all beings, with effort, in the middle of the life-force, O Mothers,

analyzed: vikāsayanti paramam tejaḥ yat vānta sambhṛtam
translated: They expand the supreme splendor that is gathered within the exhaled breath.

analyzed: te na uditaḥ nodayanti melāpa ādi samṛddhayaḥ
translated: They do not rise when not aroused, but the accomplishments of union and so forth arise when aroused.

analyzed: pratyakṣa rūpaḥ vīrāṇām sa bāhya abhyantaram sthitāḥ
translated: He is the external and internal form of the heroes, abiding in both.

analyzed: saṃvidyā hṛdaya ādīnām yoginām kaula śāsane
translated: The secret of consciousness is the heart of the yogis in the Kaula teachings.

analyzed: rahasyam jñeya gamanam bhūmiḥ atram agāhya gā
translated: The secret to be known is the fathomless depth of the earth.

original: jīvanmuktirahasyaṃ ca vīreśānāṃ sukhāgamam /🔽kathitaṃ sārasarvasvamumayāsaharaṃ param // //
analyzed: jīvanmukti rahasyam ca vīra īśānām sukha āgamam  kathitam sāra sarvasvam umā yāsa haram param
translated: And the secret of liberation in life, the blissful attainment of the lords of heroes,🔽Has been told, the essence of all essences, the supreme secret of Uma and Hara.

original: p / upeya gahvaraṃ prāyaḥ sataśotha sahasraśaḥ /
analyzed: upeya gahvaram prāyas sataśas utha sahasraśas
translated: The abyss is mostly approached hundreds and thousands of times.

original: tasmāt sarvaprayatnena na deyaṃ yasya kasyacit // //
analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena na deyam yasya kasyacid
translated: Therefore, by all means, it should not be given to just anyone.

analyzed: eka śiṣyam idam jñānam a prakhyāpya mahātmabhiḥ
translated: This knowledge, which should not be proclaimed, is for a single disciple by the magnanimous ones.

analyzed: sarva śāstra bahis bhūtam hṛdayam yoginī kule
